name: Common Bond - Find This Mystery Author Quiz | People | 15 Questions

questions.text: In one of this writer's novels, the heroine has two female cousins. One is Maria Bertram. What is the other's first name?
questions.explanation:
Julia.

	Julia Bertram is not a very sympathetic character, but her sister Maria is even worse. A married woman, Maria Rushworth (nee Bertram) forms an adulterous relationship with Henry Crawford, her cousin Fanny's suitor.

questions.text: Who is the heroine of the last book this writer completed?
questions.explanation:
Anne Elliot.

	"Persuasion" was her last completed novel.

questions.text: What is the name of General Tilney's home?
questions.explanation:
Northanger Abbey.

	General Tilney is the villain of the tale. He mistreats the heroine simply because -- well, I won't give away the ending.

questions.text: What is Marianne Dashwood's older sister's name?
questions.explanation:
Elinor.

	Elinor is the sensible sister and Marianne is the tragic romantic.

questions.text: What is Lucy Steele's older sister's name?
questions.explanation:
Anne.

	Anne is the one who reveals Lucy's secret engagement to Edward Ferrars.

questions.text: The two youngest Bennet sisters love men dressed in what?
questions.explanation:
uniform.

	Kitty and Lydia are crazy for Army officers in red uniforms. Lydia ends up marrying one after living in sin with him.

questions.text: Which novel did this author never complete?
questions.explanation:
Sanditon.

	This fragment is set partly in "a young and rising bathing-place," a sort of summer resort.

questions.text: In "Northanger Abbey," what is the hero's last name?
questions.explanation:
Tilney.

	Henry Tilney is one of the author's wittiest characters. He rivals Elizabeth Bennet.

questions.text: Which heroine is raised by a kind, gentle governess who is a mother substitute?
questions.explanation:
Emma Woodhouse.

	Miss Taylor, Emma's governess, marries Mr. Weston. Mrs. Weston is Emma's confidante.

Northamptonshire.

	Says so on the first page. I apologize for this picky question. By the way, the quizmaker wrote her thesis on "Mansfield Park."

1775.

	She was born around the same time the U.S. was.

questions.text: What did the writer's father do for a living?
questions.explanation:
clergyman.

	She loved her father very much and was devastated when he died.

questions.text: What was the name of the writer's only sister?
questions.explanation:
Cassandra.

	Neither the writer nor her sister ever married. They were best friends like Jane and Elizabeth Bennet.

questions.text: What branch of the armed services did the writer love best?
questions.explanation:
Navy.

	Two of her brothers were Navy men. Her love and respect for the Navy is reflected in "Persuasion."

Jane Austen.

	Jane Austen (16 December 1775 - 18 July 1817) was a famous English novelist!
